section.name: Hippo Site Toolkit Development Roadmap
section.p:
This section describes the general development roadmap of the Hippo Site Toolkit for HippoECM. This roadmap is an outline of the functionality and the components that will be released in future versions of the HST. The development will focus on a flexible and extendible toolkit with which developers can create websites with content from HippoECM.
The HST should be a joy to work with when you build a site with the repository :-). This roadmap is a general list of components and functionalities that will end up in future releases. Any feedback on these issues is more than welcome

subsection.name: Templating
subsection.p: Templating can be very useful in sites that unlock repository content and to speed up development. For this purpose the HST will have functionality to add templates of proven templating frameworks to the repository and to maintain them with the cms. Among the possible templating frameworks are Tiles, Freemarker and Velocity.

subsection.name: Components
subsection.p: A huge focus in the development of the HST is on its component library. One has to think of components with basic functionality like retrieving content from and writing data to the repository and of higher level components like components for displaying paginated repository content, the generation of content as rss feeds, dictionary support, forum functionality, sitemaps and sitemenu's, polls and many more.

Our aim is to create extendible components so that developers can create their own components on top of the available component stack and we encourage the contribution of these components to Onehippo's forge.

Together with the content modelling features of Hippo ECM this results in a powerful framework to create sites that expose repository content in a structural manner with rich component based functionality in an efficient way.
The initial chosen technology for the HST is JSP and tag libraries.
